segment.source: Edition upgrade policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Edition upgrade policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Edition upgrade policy settings in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Edition upgrade policy settings in Microsoft Intune

segment.source: The Edition Upgrade Policy lets you automatically upgrade devices that run one of the following Windows 10 versions to a newer edition:
segment.target: The Edition Upgrade Policy lets you automatically upgrade devices that run one of the following Windows 10 versions to a newer edition:

segment.source: Windows 10 Desktop
segment.target: Windows 10 Desktop

segment.source: Windows 10 Holographic
segment.target: Windows 10 Holographic

segment.source: Before you start
segment.target: Before you start

segment.source: Before you begin to upgrade devices to the latest version, you will need one of the following:
segment.target: Before you begin to upgrade devices to the latest version, you will need one of the following:

segment.source: A product key which is valid to install the new version of Windows on all devices you target with the policy (for Windows 10 Desktop editions).
segment.target: A product key which is valid to install the new version of Windows on all devices you target with the policy (for Windows 10 Desktop editions).

segment.source: A licence file from Microsoft which contains the licensing information to install the new version of Windows on all devices you target with the policy (for Windows 10 Mobile and Windows 10 Holographic editions).
segment.target: A licence file from Microsoft which contains the licensing information to install the new version of Windows on all devices you target with the policy (for Windows 10 Mobile and Windows 10 Holographic editions).

segment.source: The Windows 10 devices you target must be enrolled in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: The Windows 10 devices you target must be enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Configure the edition upgrade policy
segment.target: Configure the edition upgrade policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy.

segment.source: In the Policy workspace, click Configuration Policies > Add.
segment.target: In the Policy workspace, click Configuration Policies > Add.

segment.source: In the Create a New Policy dialog box, expand Windows, and then click one of the following policies:
segment.target: In the Create a New Policy dialog box, expand Windows, and then click one of the following policies:

segment.source: Edition Upgrade Policy (Windows 10 Desktop and later)
segment.target: Edition Upgrade Policy (Windows 10 Desktop and later)

segment.source: Edition Upgrade Policy (Windows 10 Holographic and later)
segment.target: Edition Upgrade Policy (Windows 10 Holographic and later)

segment.source: Click Create Policy.
segment.target: Click Create Policy.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.
segment.target: You cannot create a configuration policy using recommended settings.

segment.source: You must create a custom policy.
segment.target: You must create a custom policy.

segment.source: On the Create Policy page, specify the following options which are common to all of the edition upgrade policies.
segment.target: On the Create Policy page, specify the following options which are common to all of the edition upgrade policies.

segment.source: Name - Enter a name for the edition upgrade policy.
segment.target: Name - Enter a name for the edition upgrade policy.

segment.source: Description - Optionally, enter a description for the policy that helps you identify it in the console.
segment.target: Description - Optionally, enter a description for the policy that helps you identify it in the console.

segment.source: Edition to upgrade to - From the drop-down list, select the version of Windows 10 Desktop, Windows 10 Holographic, or Windows 10 Mobile that you want to upgrade targeted devices to.
segment.target: Edition to upgrade to - From the drop-down list, select the version of Windows 10 Desktop, Windows 10 Holographic, or Windows 10 Mobile that you want to upgrade targeted devices to.

segment.source: Product Key - Specify the product key that you obtained from Microsoft which can be used to upgrade all targeted Windows 10 Desktop devices.
segment.target: Product Key - Specify the product key that you obtained from Microsoft which can be used to upgrade all targeted Windows 10 Desktop devices.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: After you create a policy containing a product key, you cannot edit the product key later.
segment.target: After you create a policy containing a product key, you cannot edit the product key later.

segment.source: This is because the key is obscured for security reasons.
segment.target: This is because the key is obscured for security reasons.

segment.source: To change the product key, you must re-enter the entire key.
segment.target: To change the product key, you must re-enter the entire key.

segment.source: License File - Click Browse to select the license file you obtained from Microsoft that contains license information for the Windows Holographic edition you want to upgrade targeted devices to.
segment.target: License File - Click Browse to select the license file you obtained from Microsoft that contains license information for the Windows Holographic edition you want to upgrade targeted devices to.

segment.source: Click Save Policy once you are done.
segment.target: Click Save Policy once you are done.

segment.source: Deploy the edition upgrade policy
segment.target: Deploy the edition upgrade policy

segment.source: Deploy the edition upgrade policy to one or more groups of users in your organization.
segment.target: Deploy the edition upgrade policy to one or more groups of users in your organization.

segment.source: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to deploy policies, see Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.
segment.target: A status summary and alerts In the Policy workspace identify issues with the policy that require your attention.

segment.source: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.
segment.target: Additionally, a status summary appears in the Dashboard workspace.

segment.source: Once the policy reaches a targeted Windows PC, the PC will be restarted within two hours to apply the upgrade.
segment.target: Once the policy reaches a targeted Windows PC, the PC will be restarted within two hours to apply the upgrade.

segment.source: Ensure you inform any users to which you deploy the policy.
segment.target: Ensure you inform any users to which you deploy the policy.

segment.source: See also
segment.target: See also

segment.source: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
